fullText: Teaneck, October 24-26, 2008 Call for Registration [1] St. Mark's Cathedral, on the occasion of its 50th Anniversary, is holding an international symposium on Jacob of Sarug and His Times. The symposium will be held on October 24-26, 2008 at 260 Elm Ave, Teaneck, NJ. The symposium speakers are: Susan Ashbrook Harvey, Brown University Sharbil Alexandre Bcheiry, Syriac Orthodox Archdiocese Sebastian P. Brock, University of Oxford Sidney Griffith, The Catholic University of America Mary Hansbury, Philadelphia Amir Harrak, University of Toronto George A. Kiraz, Beth Mardutho & Gorgias Press Edward G. Mathews, St. Nerses Seminary Kathleen McVey, Princeton Theological Seminary Aho Shemunkasho, University of Salzburg Lucas Van Rompay, Duke University [2] To register contact Info@SyrianOrthodoxChurch.Org or (201) 907-0122. The Symposium Secretary is Jack C. Darakjy, Symposium Secretariat, 161 Main Street, Suite 2, Hackensack, NJ 07601-7114. [3] Accommodation: Attendees are expected to make their own arrangements. The closest hotel (2 miles from the Cathedral) is the Teaneck Marriott at Glenpointe, 100 Frank W Burr Blvd, Teaneck, NJ 07666, Tel. 800-804-6835. Web site: Teaneck Marriott . [4] Travel: The closest airport is Newark International, ca. 20 minutes drive from Teaneck. The closest train station is NJ Transit station at Hackensack.
title: Jacob of Sarug and His Times: Studies in Sixth Century Syriac Christianity
Hugoye: Journal of Syriac Studies
displayTitleEnglish: Jacob of Sarug and His Times: Studies in Sixth Century Syriac Christianity
